definition: lit. lone army putting up a brave fight (idiom)/fig. (of a person or group of people) struggling hard without support

sentences.english: Abandoned by the company, Peter's wife, Alice, must deal with it on her own.
sentences.chinese: 彼得被公司拋下不管，其妻艾莉絲惟有孤軍奮戰。

sentences.english: Remain kylin to fight bravely in an isolated force in this block battlefield.
sentences.chinese: 剩下麒麟在這個街區戰場中孤軍奮戰。

sentences.english: The anti-Gaddafi forces acknowledge that they could not have done it alone.
sentences.chinese: 反對派也承認，他們不能只靠孤軍奮戰。

sentences.english: The Chinese government does not care what will happen, you are not alone.
sentences.chinese: 中國不會放手不管，你孤軍奮戰。

definition: lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
lit. the path exhausted, the end of the road (idiom); an impasse/in a plight with no way out/things have reached a dead end
nowhere to go/at the end of one's tether
lit. people rebelling and friends deserting (idiom)/fig. to find oneself utterly isolated
to be unable to withstand a single blow/to collapse at the first blow
fuse (for explosives)/(fig.) proximate cause/the last straw
War and Peace by Tolstoy 托爾斯泰|托尔斯泰
stumbling block/obstacle/someone who gets in your way
to watch the fires burning across the river/to delay entering the fray until all others have been exhausted by fighting amongst themselves (idiom)
